content: written with us terminology see the table above for the uk/australian equivalents the hedgehog is worked in rounds without turning or joining for the head and body use a stitch marker to keep track of your work attach it to the first stitch of the round replacing it when you start the next round if you prefer printed patterns but want to save ink and paper you can print the appendix only pages 9-10 - it contains the crochet instructions without photos how to read the pattern the instructions for each round start with the round number in bold and end with the total stitch count in parentheses instructions in square brackets must be repeated the specified number of times before continuing with the remaining instructions of the round if any curly braces are used when multiple stitches must be worked into the same st other than the single_crochet increase which has its own abbreviation a free pattern by kati gálusz ravelry // etsy // lovecrafts please don t hesitate to contact me lunacollie@gmail com or via ravelry or etsy if you have any problem following the pattern or notice a mistake or just to show me your creation 4 special stitches 3-double_crochet-bobble start as you would a normal double_crochet yarn over insert hook in stitch and pull up a loop yarn over and pull through 2 loops on hook fig a but instead of finishing the double_crochet yarn over again then insert hook in the same stitch and pull up a loop fig b yarn over and pull through 2 loops on hook now you will have two half-finished double_crochet worked into the same stitch fig c repeat the instructions in the brackets once more so you will have 3 unfinished double_crochet in total 4 loops on your hook fig d yarn over again and pull through all loops on hook fig e bobbles tend to be formed on the back of the work - if necessary push them from the back so they pop out fig f 4-double_crochet-bobble this stitch is worked the same way as the 3-double_crochet-bobble just with one more unfinished double_crochet added before completing the stitch so yarn over insert hook in stitch and pull up a loop yarn over and pull through 2 loops on hook 4 times - you will have 4 unfinished double_crochet in total 5 loops on your hook fig g yarn over again and pull through all loops on hook fig h a free pattern by kati gálusz ravelry // etsy // lovecrafts please don t hesitate to contact me lunacollie@gmail com or via ravelry or etsy if you have any problem following the pattern or notice a mistake or just to show me your creation 5 the pattern head and body round 1 with plain yarn make a magic_ring single_crochet 6 and pull the ring closed 6 round 2 increase single_crochet 5 7 round 3 single_crochet in each st 7 round 4 single_crochet increase 3 single_crochet 3 10 take
